abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Agricultural Services Rehabilitation
            Project (ASRP). The primary objective was to initiate a
            process of rehabilitation to enable Ministry of Food and
            Agriculture (MOFA) to provide effective support to
            agriculture and this would be through strengthening the
            institutional framework for the formulation and
            implementation of agricultural policies and programs and
            improving the delivery of public services in the sector.
            Corresponding components were: (i) strengthening MOFA's
            capacity for policy formulation, planning, monitoring and
            evaluation; (ii) carrying out policy reform, focusing on
            privatization and divestiture of fertilizer and veterinary
            drugs distribution, tractor hire services, and other
            state-owned enterprises in the agriculture sector; and,
            (iii) improving agricultural support services in research,
            irrigation and extension. Bank performance was satisfactory.
            Borrowers performance was satisfactory. The key findings in
            the project were: (i) a demoralized bureaucracy is slow to
            respond to efforts to improve its operations, particularly
            in an environment where macroeconomic reform substantially
            erodes the buying power of salaries; (ii) Bank's
            procurement and disbursement procedures require much forward
            planning and painstaking attention to detail and it takes
            time to understand firstly, why the procedures are necessary
            and, secondly, actually make the effort to comply with them;
            the situation is worsened if there is no direct benefit
            accruing to individuals involved; (iii) having gained
            training and experience, staff become more marketable as an
            economy liberalizes and are likely to move out of the public
            sector and therefore affect sustainability of activities
            supported under the project: and (iv) institutions which are
            being strengthened through a learning-by-doing process need
            a longer time to implement activities and projects
            identified for this purpose.
